alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 11:30AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Laurel, southeastern Pulaski, south central Jackson, north central McCreary and west central Clay Counties through NOON EST... At 1130 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bent to near Mount Victory to near Huxley. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Billows around 1135 AM EST. Holly Bay Rec. Area, Bunch and Vox around 1140 AM EST. London, Hightop, Wood Creek Lake, Hare, Keavy, Hazel Patch, Bernstadt and Carmichael around 1145 AM EST. Victory, Pittsburg, Lily, Maplesville, Atlanta, East Bernstadt and Dorthae around 1150 AM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Levi Jackson S.P., Peoples, Fariston, Lesbas, Mcwhorter, Moores Creek, Cornelius, Langnau, London-Corbin Airport, Crawford, Benge, Annville, Settle Store, Bond, Green Hill, Datha, Welchburg, Fogertown, Royrader and Deer Lick. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 29 and 49. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 37 and 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
